thing-type.label: Tag Reader 500 WTRFID Mini Keypad
thing-type.description: WTRFID Mini Keypad<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtA Z-Wave security enabled entry control device. You can arm/disarm your house to home or away with the Tag Reader 500. With the use of a RFID tag or a numerical code the device can send an entry control message which can be handled by a supported gateway. In addition the Tag Reader supports the activation of scenes.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtTo include the Tag Reader 500 US press and hold the enter button for two seconds (indication LED blinks shortly). </li&gt <li&gtRelease the enter button now to start the inclusion (during the inclusion routine the indication LED willblink twice per second).</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtTo exclude the Tag Reader 500 US press and hold the enter button for two seconds (indication LED blinks shortly). </li&gt <li&gtRelease the enter button now to start the exclusion (during the exclusion routine the indication LED willblink twice three times per 1,5 second).</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtPress and hold the button for 7 seconds, the indication LED will go on for 1 full second.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Set to Default
parameter.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf the Value is set to 0xFF (255) this device will return to factory settings.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Feedback time
parameter.description: the time the beep goes to off<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0x00 = Off, 0xFF = endless</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Feedback time-out
parameter.description: waiting for the wake-up-no-more command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtToo configure the time-out, waiting on the wakeup_no_more_information command before the error sound starts automatically. The error sound is set to 8 short beeps.</p&gt <p&gt0x00 = off</p&gt <p&gt0x01 – 0xFF: Value in seconds</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: feedback beeps per second
parameter.description: Amount of beeps a second<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTo set the amount of beeps per second, every beep is around 10ms.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Always awake mode
parameter.description: Always awake mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtMode 1 = normal working mode</p&gt <p&gtMode 3 = z-wave chip is always on to be asked for information, for example version or manufacturer ID.</p&gt <p&gtAny other value will be reported after a GET, but will be seen as a mode 1.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Operation mode
parameter.description: Operation mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0x00: the RFID and Numeric codes are reported in gateway mode</li&gt <li&gt0x01 – 0xFF: the RFID and Numeric codes are reported in local mode</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Gateway confirmation
parameter.description: Gateway confirmation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gtIn gateway mode it is possible to let the gateway decide if the Tag Reader 500 can arm to home or away.</li&gt <li&gtIf gateway indication is disabled the Tag Reader 500 automatically assumes that it can arm and will wait for a user input of RFID TAG or numeric code. </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt
